SafetyInspectionBy: Iowa Department of Agriculture & Land Stewardship

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Risk Management Plan - Executive Summary



Facility:  Atchison County AGChoice Coin

Location:  1964 270 Street, Coin, IA 51636

Contact:  Jared Grimes

Phone:  712-583-3215





1. The Facility Policy



MFA Enterprises, Inc., and the employees of the Atchison County AGChoice Ammonia Plant Coin are committed to the prevention of any accidental release of anhydrous ammonia. If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the Page County Emergency Management Agency and other authorities to mitigate any release and minimize the impact of the release to people and the environment.



2.  Stationary Source and Regulated Substance Handled



The facility operates an anhydrous ammonia storage facility and sells the regulated substance, anhydrous ammonia, for direct application as a crop nutrient.



3. The Accident Release Prevention Program



The Accidental Release Prevention Program for the location consists of following the provisions of:



a.    40 CFR Part 68

b.    OSHA 29 CFR 1910.111

c.    Iowa IAC 21-43.6 (200)

d.    CGA G.2.1 - 2014



4. The Five-year Accident History



There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past five years that: have caused any deaths, injuries, or significant property damage at the facility; nor to our knowledge, have resulted in offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage.



5. The Emergency Response Program



The facility has;



a. a written emergency action plan, in accordance with OSHA Standard, 29 CFR 1910.38;



b. provided State and Local authorities with the emergency planning and community

   right-to-know information as required under SARA Title III (EPCRA);



c. employees will not respond to any release other than to activate emergency shutoff valves

   while evacuating the facility if it is safe for them to do so.  Local responders will be notified

   to control any release.



6.  Planned Changes to Improve Safety

Safety improvement is an on-going process at the facility.  Periodic evaluations are performed to assess the condition and operation of the facility and improvements are made where warranted.



01/31/2022
